item.title: PS4 Will Reportedly Start Losing Some Services in 2026
item.description:
PlayStation 4 games are reportedly losing access to several key services in 2026. The purported move would mark a major acceleration of Sony's efforts to drop its PS4 support.

November 15 will mark the 12th anniversary of Sony's eighth-generation console. While the PS4 is still receiving updates as of 2025, the Japanese gaming giant has been shifting resources away from the system in recent years, signaling plans to fully end its support in the foreseeable future.

New PS4 Games Reportedly Losing Access to 6 Key Services in 2026

This trend will continue in 2026 with Sony barring new PS4 games from integrating certain legacy PSN features, Insider Gaming's Tom Henderson reports, citing PlayStation documentation said to have been forwarded to some developers. The list of functionalities affected by the purported move comprises six services: Activity Feed Web API, Shared Media Web API, Title Small Storage, Title User Storage, Word Filters, and Users and Profiles. Existing PS4 games utilizing these services will reportedly retain access to them.

PS Plus Is Also Starting to Phase Out PS4 Offerings in 2026

The selective feature discontinuation is expected to come into effect in spring 2026, as per the same source. That timing places it shortly after the previously announced plan to begin phasing out PS4 games from PlayStation Plus, scheduled to start in January. From that point forward, Sony will stop prioritizing PS4 titles for PS Plus subscribers. The existing catalog of third-party games for the last-generation console will eventually be removed from the PS Plus library as well.

Sony's previously confirmed plans and this newly surfaced report both suggest that the company's efforts to end PS4 support will accelerate in 2026. Limiting developers' access to APIs and web services as basic as user profiles and title storage—used for persisting user-specific data such as settings and session buffers—would heavily discourage them from releasing new PS4 games. The removal of such features would likely spell the end of big-budget releases on the console, as well as disincentivize any new multiplayer titles from launching on the device.

PS4 Services Reportedly Being Sunset in 2026

  • Activity Feed Web API
  • Shared Media Web API
  • Title Small Storage (TSS)
  • Title User Storage (TUS)
  • Users and Profiles
  • Word Filters

As things currently stand, Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 may be the last AAA game to release on the PS4. And though the console is likely to keep receiving security patches and other minor updates for a while yet, Sony appears prepared to fully pull the plug on it in the coming years, perhaps by the time the PS6 materializes in or around late 2027. The PlayStation maker had already ceased all PS4 production circa 2022—about a year later than initially planned—due to PS5 shortages caused by various supply chain issues originating from the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Pokemon Issues Apology Over Paradox Tera Raid Event Bug
item.description:
The current Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Paradox Tera Raid event has an ongoing issue that prevents users from joining raids hosted by players with the opposite version, prompting an apology from The Pokemon Company. The company has stated that it is looking into these Tera Raid issues for Pokemon Scarlet and Violet , but has not offered a timetable for a fix.

On October 2, Pokemon Scarlet and Violet started a Paradox Tera Raid event highlighted by Seven-Star battles against Roaring Moon and Iron Valiant. The event also brought back Five-Star Tera Raids against Paradox Pokemon like Great Tusk and Iron Treads for trainers to battle. Iron Valiant has the Fairy-Tera type, while Roaring Moon is a Dragon-Tera monster. The Tera Raid event concludes on Sunday, October 12, at 7:59 PM Eastern. It is unclear if the Iron Valiant and Roaring Moon events will get a second run in the future, so Pokemon trainers have a limited time to participate.

Pokemon Acknowledges Issues With October 2025 Paradox Tera Raid Event

Although previous Paradox Tera Raid events allowed Pokemon Scarlet and Violet trainers to participate in the opposite version's battles via the Internet, that is currently not the case with Iron Valiant and Roaring Moon. While some Pokemon Scarlet and Violet players pondered whether this move was intentional or not, The Pokemon Company clarified that a bug is impeding players' enjoyment of the event. Currently, Pokemon Scarlet players cannot join Iron Valiant Tera Raids, and Pokemon Violet players cannot battle Roaring Moon. The Pokemon Company has stated that it is investigating the bug and apologized to players for any inconvenience caused. However, the developers offered no timetable for a fix, so Pokemon trainers must wait for more information.

For the time being, Roaring Moon and Iron Valiant can only be battled in their respective versions until the problem is resolved. During each battle, Roaring Moon and Iron Valiant will respectively use Sunny Day and Electric Terrain from the start. These moves, in turn, will activate their Protosynthesis and Quark Drive abilities, which boost one of their highest base stats by a level. Given that each Seven-Star Paradox Pokemon has ways to increase its strongest statistics and counter its weaknesses, Pokemon Scarlet and Violet players must neutralize any stat changes to make the Tera Raid battles easier to manage.

Between the Paradox Tera Raid issues and the controversial Shiny Koraidon and Miraidon distribution event, Pokemon Scarlet and Violet players have taken to social media to express their recent dissatisfaction. It remains to be seen how The Pokemon Company will remedy the current Tera Raid situation.

52
8.1 /10
6 /10

item.title: All Kitsune Puzzles in Ghost of Yotei (Fox Statues + Cipher)
item.description:
The Kitsune is mysterious, cunning, and a genius when it comes to setting up puzzles and traps. The Kitsune will deter Atsu's journey in Ghost of Yotei in any way possible, so players are going to have to outwit the Kitsune by learning how the puzzles work in the Teshio Region that involve fox statues and a cipher. Throughout the entire Kitsune questline in Ghost of Yotei , players will come across many different fox statue puzzles , so we've compiled them all here in one place so that you know exactly what to do when you're facing the next puzzle that's halting progress between Atsu and the Yotei Six.

How to Translate the Kitsune Cipher in Ghost of Yotei

To start, it's best to go through what the cipher actually means and how you can better understand it for the puzzles ahead. Players will get the cipher by progressing through the Kitsune main quest in the north region of Teshio Ridge. Once they do, it's going to be imperative to understand how the puzzles work in this region. When you're near a fox puzzle, you can view the cipher at any time by swiping Right on the Touch Pad. For a basic demonstration, this is how it works. If a fox statue lying down has the symbol of a square on it, then it means that the lying down fox must be rotated so that it is facing left. This rule applies to all symbols and corresponding foxes. However, players should be aware that the symbol with the lines (death) means that you should not interact with it, or else you will be placed into a kill trap.

Below is a rundown of every Kitsune puzzle to help you progress once you get the cipher!

How to Enter the Nine Tails Hideout in Ghost of Yotei

The first Kitsune puzzle that players will come across will showcase a locked door with two howling fox statues. In order to complete this puzzle, players simply need to pick up a flaming torch from one of the nearby pyres and light the 2 braziers that have a fox statue on them . If you've accidentally lit other statues, then simply interact with them with R2 to blow out the light. Doing so will then open the way forward.

How to Solve the Find a Way Forward Puzzle in Ghost of Yotei

You'll eventually fight shinobi up the mountain, and you'll come up to a puzzle involving more nine-tailed foxes. However, two statues are missing from the front gate. All you need to do is locate the two missing statues and place them in the correct order. The fox with his right paw raised needs to go on the left podium, and the fox with his left paw raised needs to go into the right podium .

How to Solve the Upper Building Puzzle in Ghost of Yotei

After obtaining the cipher and exiting the building via the fox statue on the left of the main door, you'll be faced with yet another puzzle. This time, there are four fox statues to move. Here's the correct order to move the foxes, from left to right:

  • Facing right
  • Facing forward
  • Facing backward
  • Facing left

Doing so will unlock the ladder and allow you to access the upper building, where you will obtain some sweet new Shinobi armor. You can now continue on with your quest with little delay until later, when you come across the Dye House.

How to Solve the Black Dye House Puzzle in Ghost of Yotei

Enter the Black Dye House, where you'll find fox statues to the left of the room. Pick up the fox statue that has its right paw raised, and place it onto the right podium. With the fox statue locked into place, rotate the right wooden board until the arrow is pointed to the right . Now, pick up the other fox statue, which has its left paw raised, and place it on the left podium to lock it into place. With the left wooden board on the floor, rotate the symbol so that the arrow is facing left . Doing so correctly will see the middle wooden board open to reveal a ladder that allows you to access a basement area into a secret hideout to continue the quest.

How to Solve the Get Into the Building Puzzle in Ghost of Yotei

Through the caverns after the Black Dye House, and after rescuing the prisoners, you'll enter a hideout filled with shinobi. In this area, players are going to need to fight through the enemies, and across the path will be different fox statues in unique poses, with a symbol painted behind them. However, if you just want the puzzle solution, then head to the central building that's lit with lamps, and has four foxes at the front of the building. It's vitally important that players do not touch the fox on the back left, as this is marked with the death symbol and will summon more enemies. Here's the order for the foxes :

  • The front left fox (right paw raised fox) must be facing the right
  • The front right fox (lying down fox) must be facing the right
  • The back right fox (stalking fox) must be facing the left
  • The back left fox doesn't matter, so keep it facing forward

How to Solve the Pedestal Under the Tree Puzzle in Ghost of Yotei

After navigating into the forests with Oyuki, you will be faced with a pedestal under a tree with three foxes. To solve this puzzle, you must use a torch found in the lit pit and light 3 correct braziers around the surrounding area. The correct braziers are the ones that have the same fox statues, so you're looking for a brazier that has:

  • lying down fox
  • sitting fox
  • lying down fox

How to Solve the Find a Way Into the Forest Puzzle in Ghost of Yotei

Later in the quest, you'll enter the forest area, and you'll come across three fox statues. You can find the correct symbol that corresponds with each fox statue around this area, from the left, right, and below the bridge. However, we'll outline the correct positions here :

  • The left fox (lying down) must be facing the right
  • The middle fox (sitting) must be facing backwards, looking away
  • The right fox (right paw raised) must be facing the left

Upon the completion of this puzzle, players will enter a pathway covered in snow, but with traps to watch out for. The clue for the correct path is located on the fox statue, but to avoid a death pit, you just need to head right of the fox statue and then left of the next rock.

How to Solve the Venture Further Into the Forest Puzzle in Ghost of Yotei

The final Kitsune puzzle showcases yet another locked gate with two fox statues that you can pick up. around the area. This puzzle is simpler than the rest, so pick up the fox with its right paw raised and place it in the left pedestal , and then pick up the fox with its left paw raised and place it in the right pedestal to unlock the final door.

9.7 /10
10 /10

Ghost of Yotei

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Reveals Upcoming Changes to Beta
item.description:
Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 developer Treyarch Studios has released a list of changes that fans can expect to see roll out for the game's beta this weekend, which includes highly requested adjustments to the game's time-to-kill (TTK), doors, weapon XP, and more. Early access to the Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 beta kicked off on October 2, and it hasn't taken Treyarch long to hear the feedback loud and clear, as a new update is live now with more adjustments set for the coming days.

Those eager to go hands-on with Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 will be pleased to know there are multiple ways to access the beta. The easiest way is to simply wait until October 5, which is when the official open beta will kick off for players around the world. Or, for those who are a little more impatient, pre-ordering Black Ops 7 will grant early access to the beta right now. Activision is also making it easier than ever to get early access to the beta this year, as there are numerous promotions with the likes of Xfinity for fans in the US, EE for those in the UK, or by watching select Twitch streams for a designated amount of time.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Beta Update Will Tweak TTK

The Black Ops 7 beta has only been live for 24 hours, but Treyarch Studios has already released a brand-new update with UI and stability improvements. But the best is still to come, as the developer has confirmed that a more significant update will be released this weekend with adjustments to TTK, doors, weapon XP, and more. The former of the bunch has been a huge talking point over the last 24 hours, which has led Treyarch to announce a new weapon balancing pass that will release in the coming days. The studio says the changes will "adjust TTK and ensure all weapons available in the beta are competitive within both their class and their intended role within Black Ops 7 ."

Another big change set for this weekend is a reduction in how quickly automatic doors close on Black Ops 7 's maps. Alongside TTK, the automatic doors found in Black Ops 7 have been another huge talking point. While Treyarch removed the controversial manual doors from previous entries, their replacement has been less than favorable. Thankfully, a new update will force specific automatic doors to remain open from the start of the match, increase how long automatic doors remain open before they close, and increase the distance a player needs to be from the door before it will automatically open.

One thing yet to be addressed by Treyarch is a controversial scorestreak in Black Ops 7 . The Gravemaker, which appears to be one of the most powerful scorestreaks in the game, has the ability to see enemies through walls and one-shot them. Some fans believe it's in serious need of a nerf, while others believe that it should be overpowered as it's one of the most expensive scorestreaks in the game. Regardless of opinion, it looks like Treyarch won't be adjusting it for the beta this weekend.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Beta Update Patch Notes

Time-to-Kill

Time-to-Kill (TTK) and overall weapon balance has been a conversation we've been keeping an eye on, along with evaluating in-game data from day one of the Beta. While we’re starting the Beta with a TTK in the range of Black Ops 6, we’re aware that some players feel it may be slightly faster than desired. As a result, we'll be releasing a weapon balance pass in the coming days to adjust TTK and ensure all weapons available in the Beta are competitive within both their class and their intended role within Black Ops 7.

We're excited to get these changes in your hands as we continue to gather feedback and data to ensure our launch lineup of 30 weapons are as balanced and as fun to use as possible.

Doors

While there are no manual doors in any Black Ops 7 Multiplayer maps, only five of our 16 6v6 maps at launch will have automatic doors. With that said, we are closely following the community discussion about doors on our Beta maps and evaluating our launch and post-launch portfolio of maps.

Based on the feedback we’ve already seen in the first 24 hours, we’ll be making the following changes to the Beta in an upcoming update:

  • Forcing specific automatic doors to remain open from the start of the match.
  • Increasing how long automatic doors remain open before they close.
  • Increasing the distance a player needs to be from the door before it will automatically open.
  • Players can still shoot automatic doors to open them.

Changes we are considering for launch and beyond:

  • Evaluating a potential reduction in the number of automatic doors across our entire map portfolio. While some doors may make sense to remove, others may bring about new issues with opening undesired lines of sight. We will share more details as we have them.
  • Adding the ability to disable automatic doors in Private Match for competitive testing.

Weapon XP, Overclock Earn Rates, Spawns, Bug Fixes

We’ve also seen discussion about Weapon XP earn rates and want everyone to be able to unlock and test plenty of attachments during the Beta so you can provide valuable feedback and we can gather important data, so we’re going to help you out there. We’re also doing the same for Overclock earn rates, as well as adjusting our spawn system and knocking out some early bugs.

Planned for tomorrow’s update:

  • Increasing Weapon XP earn rate
  • Increasing Overclock earn rate for several Loadout items and Scorestreaks
  • Adjustments made to spawn logic for improved spawning across several maps and modes
  • Various bug fixes including Weapons

We’ll be sharing more details on the items above when the patch goes live over the weekend. In the meantime, here’s what’s been fixed in today’s update:

Day 2 Patch Notes

UI

  • Addressed an issue on Steam where social menus would close when the player was set as away.
  • Addressed an error that could occur when navigating between menu tabs.
  • Addressed an issue that could delay login.

Stability

  • Addressed various server stability issues related to player loadouts, the Tracker Perk, Drone Pod, Pinpoint Grenade, and Skewer Scorestreak.

See you in the lobby, and good luck against the undead!

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7

item.title: Marvel Rivals Offering Players a Free Skin With a Catch
item.description:
Marvel Rivals appears to be getting ready to offer a new Daredevil skin for free, but only for Disney+ users who reside in the US. The Season 4.5 update is right around the corner, and it's set to be headlined by one of Marvel's most popular heroes in Daredevil. The character's Disney+ series Daredevil: Born Again premiered earlier this year, and so it's fitting that the Devil of Hell's Kitchen is finally making his way to Marvel Rivals .

Named Heart of the Dragon, the fourth season of Marvel Rivals kicked off on September 12 and saw the debut of the game's latest Vanguard hero, Angela. A lesser-known hero of Marvel Comics, Angela got her start as part of Image Comics in the 90s, mainly appearing next to Spawn before being added to the Marvel universe in 2013. Marvel Rivals players were also treated to a new map in K'un Lun - Heart of Heaven, as well as a swimsuit event to close out the summer.

Free Daredevil Skin Giveaway is Exclusive to Disney+ Subs in the US

With Daredevil's arrival in Marvel Rivals looming, it's been discovered by Twitter user Miller Ross that the hero will be accompanied by a new skin that's being given away for free to Disney+ subscribers from October 10, the start of Season 4.5, until January 8, 2026. Unfortunately, the skin, a re-color themed around the blue branding of Disney+, will only be available to Disney+ subscribers who reside in the US.

All hope is not lost for Marvel Rivals players around the globe and those who aren't subscribed to Disney's streaming service, as the Disney+ Daredevil skin will still be available in the in-game store for 600 Units. This amount of Units costs $5 Lattice, Marvel Rivals ' premium currency, though Units are also earnable for free just by playing the game. It's understandable for this new Daredevil skin giveaway to be exclusive to Disney+ subscribers, as it's a perk of the streaming service, but its regional exclusivity is still a complete head scratcher.

Season 4.5 is set to begin in Marvel Rivals on October 10, bringing with it new Team-Up abilities, a new, yet to be revealed game mode, the game's first-ever Halloween event, a host of balancing changes, and public testing for the game's highly sought-after cross-platform progression feature. Marvel Rivals fans in the US who are also subscribed to Disney+ should keep an eye on their emails for the free redemption code that'll net them this new Daredevil skin.

108
8.8 /10
9 /10

Marvel Rivals

Marvel Rivals is a Super Hero Team-Based PVP Shooter!
Assemble an all-star Marvel squad, devise countless strategies by combining powers to form unique Team-Up skills and fight in destructible, ever-changing battlefields across the continually evolving Marvel universe!

A Deep and Varied Marvel Roster
Choose from a vast array of fan-favorite and cult-classic Marvel Super Heroes and Super Villains from across the Avengers, Guardians of the Galaxy, X-Men, and many more from across the Marvel Multiverse.

Fast and Fun 6v6 Action with Ever-Changing Game Dynamics
With intricate environments, fast-paced gameplay, and ever-changing battlefields, there's never a dull moment in Marvel Rivals! Battle as Super Heroes and Super Villains with incredible abilities and combine your powers to bring unexpected fun to the battlefield in a matter of seconds.

Dynamic Hero Synergy
Coordinate unique combinations between characters to ignite surprising Team-Up Skills! Unleash the synergy of combined superpowers and invent new tactics that can turn the tide of combat. Ride on Groot's back as Rocket Raccoon to take on your enemies as a dangerous duo, unleash Gamma energy as Hulk to charge Iron Man's armor for massive damage, and so much more!

Creative Environment Destruction
Tear your way through iconic Marvel worlds across destructible environments! From Asgard to the Tokyo of 2099, use superpowers to alter these environments, reshape the terrain, and craft a strategic advantage on the battlefield! Take cover to dodge attacks or use makeshift weapons to strike down enemies. Players will find countless ways to utilize the environment to claim victory!

Continually Evolving Universe and Robust Post-Launch Updates
The Marvel Multiverse brings infinite possibilities! Each seasonal drop will introduce new Super Heroes to the battlefield along with challenging and diverse maps! Unlock new content to implement across various gameplay strategies while experiencing thrilling action and endless possibilities in these adventurous team battles!
